page.title: 01S.E. LEIGHTON BUZZARD
page.content: The area adjoining Leighton Buzzard to the south and east has some housing and some industrial development leading out to open countryside and farm land. There are signs of earlier occupation and industries: remains of early settlements at the Grove Dig, a narrow gauge railway earlier used to transport sand from the pits to the railway, but is now used for pleasure trips, and a disused railway track going from Leighton Buzzard to Dunstable. The town has become one of the fastest growing small settlements in England with new housing built for commuters: London is less than an hour by train. Billington is the only village in the area, three miles from Leighton Buzzard. It has very few amenities. There is no village policeman: a neighbourhood watch is used instead.
